title: Bounding the Mim-Width of Hereditary Graph Classes

sections.mim-width of special graph classes:
Belmonte and Vatshelle  proved that the mim-width of the following graph classes is bounded and quickly computable:
permutation graphs, convex graphs
and their complements,
interval graphs
and their complements,
circular k𝑘k-trapezoid graphs, circular permutation graphs, Dilworth-k𝑘k graphs, k𝑘k-polygon graphs, circular-arc graphs and complements of d𝑑d-degenerate graphs. Some of the results of  have been extended.
Let Kr⊟Kr⊟subscript𝐾𝑟subscript𝐾𝑟K_{r}\boxminus K_{r} be the graph obtained from 2​Kr2subscript𝐾𝑟2K_{r} by adding a perfect matching, and let Kr⊟r​P1⊟subscript𝐾𝑟𝑟subscript𝑃1K_{r}\boxminus rP_{1} be the graph obtained from Kr⊟Kr⊟subscript𝐾𝑟subscript𝐾𝑟K_{r}\boxminus K_{r} by removing all the edges in one of the complete graphs (see Section 2 for undefined notation).
Kang et al.  showed that for any integer r≥2𝑟2r\geq 2,
there is a polynomial-time algorithm for computing a branch decomposition of mim-width at most r−1𝑟1r-1 when the input is restricted to
(Kr⊟r​P1)⊟subscript𝐾𝑟𝑟subscript𝑃1(K_{r}\boxminus rP_{1})-free chordal graphs, which generalize interval graphs, or (Kr⊟Kr)⊟subscript𝐾𝑟subscript𝐾𝑟(K_{r}\boxminus K_{r})-free co-comparability graphs, which generalize permutation graphs. Hence, in particular, all these classes have bounded mim-width. Kang et al.  also proved that the classes of chordal graphs, circle graphs and co-comparability graphs have unbounded mim-width; for the latter two classes, this was shown independently by Mengel .
Vatshelle  and Brault-Baron et al. 1 showed the same for grids and chordal bipartite graphs, respectively, whereas Mengel  proved that strongly chordal split graphs have unbounded mim-width. Brettell et al. 4 considered the following generalisation of convex graphs. A bipartite graph G=(A,B,E)𝐺𝐴𝐵𝐸G=(A,B,E) is ℋℋ{\cal H}-convex, for some family of graphs ℋℋ{\cal H}, if there exists a graph H∈ℋ𝐻ℋH\in{\cal H} with V​(H)=A𝑉𝐻𝐴V(H)=A such that the set of neighbours in A𝐴A of each b∈B𝑏𝐵b\in B induces a connected subgraph of H𝐻H (when ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}} is the set of paths, we obtain exactly convex graphs). They showed that the class of ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}}-convex graphs has bounded and quickly computable mim-width if ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}} is the set of cycles, or ℋℋ{\mathcal{H}} is the set of trees with bounded maximum degree and bounded number of vertices of degree at least 333.
